it.polimi.se2018.controller

Class AlterDieValueBehaviour

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.controller.AlterDieValueBehaviour
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ToolCardBehaviour

    public class AlterDieValueBehaviour
extends java.lang.Object
implements ToolCardBehaviour
    This class manges the usage of the tool cards that alter the die value.
    Author:
    dvdmff

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AlterDieValueBehaviour(boolean isIncrement)
      Creates a new instance that will flip or increment/decrement the die, depending on the parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlterDieValueBehaviour

        public AlterDieValueBehaviour(boolean isIncrement)
        Creates a new instance that will flip or increment/decrement the die, depending on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        isIncrement - true if the die has to be incremented/decremented; false if it has to be flipped.

    • Method Detail

      • areRequirementsSatisfied

        public boolean areRequirementsSatisfied(Game game)
        Tells if the requirements for the usage are met.

        This behaviour can only be used if the player has not placed a die yet.

        Specified by:
        areRequirementsSatisfied in interface ToolCardBehaviour
        Parameters:
        game - The game the tool card will be applied to.
        Returns:
        true if the requirements are met; false otherwise.

      • askParameters

        public void askParameters(ViewMessage message)
        Selects the view to allow the user to select a die.

        In the case an increment/decrement operation is required, a more specific view is selected.

        Specified by:
        askParameters in interface ToolCardBehaviour
        Parameters:
        message - The message sent by the view.

      • useToolCard

        public ToolCardBehaviourResponse useToolCard(Game game,
                                             ViewMessage message)
        Alters the value of the selected die and puts it in the draft pool.
        Specified by:
        useToolCard in interface ToolCardBehaviour
        Parameters:
        game - the game the effect has to be applied to.
        message - the message sent by the view.
        Returns:
        true on success; false otherwise.
